messages.subject: [samuraihistory] Miura
messages.msgSnippet: ... The Miura clan took their name from the Miura peninsula, to the immediate southeast of Kamakura (Present day Yokosuka area). Not sure about their exploits
messages.messageBody:
--- masamune@... wrote:

> In the genpei war there was a clan call Miura dose
> any body now about them.
> Help me out.
>
> Thanks

The Miura clan took their name from the Miura
peninsula, to the immediate southeast of Kamakura
(Present day Yokosuka area). Not sure about their
exploits during the Gempei war, though they did serve
the Minamoto and Hojo during the Kamakura shogunate.
The Miura family continued on into the Sengoku. I
don't have the source information in front of me, but
I believe they were defeated by the Hojo (the later
Hojo) around the early 1510's or so, as Hojo Soun and
his son expanded their control of the Kanto. Miura
Yoshimoto supposedly committed suicide in defeat by
slicing off his own head--a neat trick, but sadly not
one you can repeat.

Help me out.

Thanks

De: soroush vahabi <s_whitefalcons@...>
Fecha: Jueves, Enero 13, 2005 2:56 am
Asunto: Re: [samuraihistory] Bushido

>
>
> Saito and Tukugawa made an aliance in order to crush the
> militaries of Northern rebelions once; which resulted in a full
> long -lasting victory.
>
> Kyle Ross <hawks8844@...> wrote:
>
> Do you have The Last Samurai on DVD. There is a section on the
> special feautres disc that has the characters. It is called
> Bushido:The way of the Warrior.
>
> will rogers wrote:
>
> I heard somewhere that the Tokugawa and the Saito had an alliance.
> Is this true?
>
> Richardson Paul wrote:HI
>
> I am not sure of the characters but if someone puts
> them here in an email I can convert them into a nice
> brush stroke font for you in a jpg
>
> Paul
>
>
> --- Kyle Ross wrote:
>
>
> ---------------------------------
>
> I was wondering if anyone knew where I could find a
> website that would have pictures of the kanji
> characters for the seven principles of Bushido. The
> seven principles are:Gi, Rei, Yu, Meiyo, Jin, Makoto,
> and Chu. My goal is to get all seven characters on the
> same sheet of paper. Any help would be greatly
> appreciated. Thank You.
>
